alert.note: Alert for Custer; Northern Rosebud; Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 9:59PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CUSTER...NORTH CENTRAL POWDER RIVER AND CENTRAL ROSEBUD COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM MDT... At 958 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Volborg, or 25 miles south of Miles City, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, pea size hail, heavy rainfall and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Miles City, Volborg, Hathaway, Twelve Mile Dam, Garland, Moon Creek Ranch, Strawberry Hill Recreation Area, and Matthews Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
